header.title: Healthcare Quality and Revenue Management Minor

body.text: College of Community Innovation and Education

p.College of Community Innovation and Educ:
College of Community Innovation and Education
School of Global Health Management and Informatics
Dr. Phillips Academic Commons (DPAC) - UCF Downtown, 401
407-823-2359
HIIM@ucf.edu
p.The Healthcare Quality and Revenue Manag: The Healthcare Quality and Revenue Management minor is geared to healthcare revenue cycle management. In addition to medical coding for inpatient claims, students learn about quality pay for performance programs such as the Medicare Merit-Based Incentive Payment System and Patient Satisfaction surveys.

courseSection0.text:

The Healthcare Quality and Revenue Management minor is geared to healthcare revenue cycle management. In addition to medical coding for inpatient claims, students learn about quality pay for performance programs such as the Medicare Merit-Based Incentive Payment System and Patient Satisfaction surveys.

text.College of Community Innovation and Educ: College of Community Innovation and Education
text.School of Global Health Management and I: School of Global Health Management and Informatics

courseSection0.text4: HSA4109 - Principles of Healthcare Reimbursement, Insurance, and Managed Care Plans (3)
courseSection0.text5: HSA4003 - The Patient Experience from an Administrator's Perspective (3)

li.A minimum overall GPA of 2.5 is required: A minimum overall GPA of 2.5 is required. A minimum grade of "C" (2.0) is required in each course for the minor.
li.At least 15 hours used in the minor must: At least 15 hours used in the minor must be earned at UCF within the department.
li.No credit by examination (TSD, Military: No credit by examination (TSD, Military credit) may be used.
li.Internship or Independent Study credit c: Internship or Independent Study credit cannot be used toward the minor without departmental approval.

courseSection3.text:
Other Requirements:

A minimum overall GPA of 2.5 is required. A minimum grade of "C" (2.0) is required in each course for the minor.
At least 15 hours used in the minor must be earned at UCF within the department.
No credit by examination (TSD, Military credit) may be used.
Internship or Independent Study credit cannot be used toward the minor without departmental approval.
